001package io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.reflection;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JavaType;
004import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
005
006/**
007 * A utility class for checking relations of class types
008 *
009 * @version 2.0.0
010 * @since 2.0.0
011 */
012public final class TypeUtils {
013    private TypeUtils() {
014    }
015
016    /**
017     * Checks if the given type is the same as the target type
018     *
019     * @param type       The type to check
020     * @param targetType The target type to check against
021     *
022     * @return If the given type is the same as the target type
023     *
024     * @since 2.0.0
025     */
026    public static boolean isType(@NotNull JavaType type, @NotNull JavaType targetType) {
027        return type.equals(targetType);
028    }
029
030    /**
031     * Checks if the given type is the same or a super type of the target type
032     *
033     * @param type       The type to check
034     * @param targetType The target type to check against
035     *
036     * @return If the given type is the same or a super type of the target type
037     *
038     * @since 2.0.0
039     */
040    public static boolean isTypeOrSuperTypeOf(@NotNull JavaType type, @NotNull JavaType targetType) {
041        return getDistance(type, targetType) >= 0;
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * Return the "sort value" for a type to two other types. See {@link java.util.Comparator}
046     *
047     * @param type        The type to check
048     * @param targetTypeA The first target type to check against
049     * @param targetTypeB The second target type to check against
050     *
051     * @return The "sort value" for a type to two other types
052     *
053     * @see java.util.Comparator
054     */
055    public static int sortDistance(@NotNull JavaType type, @NotNull JavaType targetTypeA, @NotNull JavaType targetTypeB) {
056        return getDistance(type, targetTypeB) - getDistance(type, targetTypeA);
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * Get the "distance" between two types. For every superclass the distance increases by 1. 0 means they are equal, -1 means it is not a superclass
061     *
062     * @param type       The type to check
063     * @param targetType The target type to check against
064     *
065     * @return The "distance" between two types. For every superclass the distance increases by 1. 0 means they are equal, -1 means it is not a superclass
066     *
067     * @since 2.0.0
068     */
069    public static int getDistance(@NotNull JavaType type, @NotNull JavaType targetType) {
070        if (isType(type, targetType)) {
071            return 0;
072        } else {
073            int distance = 0;
074
075            while ((type = type.getSuperClass()) != null) {
076                distance++;
077                if (isType(type, targetType)) {
078                    return distance;
079                }
080            }
081
082            return -1;
083        }
084    }
085}
